question: Biden at the beach for 5+ workdays in September?
description:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if US President Joe Biden spends 5 or more workdays in Rehoboth Beach, Delaware, between September 1 and September 30, 2024. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No". Note that only Rehoboth Beach will count for this market, and only Monday - Friday counts.

If any portion of a day is spent in Rehoboth Beach, Delaware, according to this market's resolution source, this market will count it as a day spent "at the beach."

The resolution source for this market will be rollcall.com (specifically https://rollcall.com/factbase/biden/topic/calendar/). If this source is not available at this market's resolution time, another source may be chosen.

question: September temperature increase by less than 1.17°C?
description:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if the data for the Global Land-Ocean Temperature Index for September 2024 shows an increase of less than 1.17°C when it is released. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

An anomaly of less than 1.17°C for September 2024 is necessary and sufficient to resolve this market to "Yes" immediately once the data becomes available regardless of whether the figure for September 2024 is later revised.

The primary resolution source for this market will be the figure found in the table titled "GLOBAL Land-Ocean Temperature Index in 0.01 degrees Celsius" under the column "Sep" in the row "2024" (https://data.giss.nasa.gov/gistemp/tabledata_v4/GLB.Ts+dSST.txt). If NASA's "Global Temperature Index" is rendered permanently unavailable, other information from NASA may be used. If no information for September 2024 is provided by NASA by January 1, 2025, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve "Yes".

events.title: September 2024 Temperature Increase (ºC)
events.description: September 2024 Temperature Increase (ºC)

question: Will Christian McCaffrey play Week 2?
description:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Christian McCaffrey plays in the San Francisco 49er's Week 2 game against the Minnesota Vikings scheduled for September 15, 2024. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

If the game is canceled or postponed beyond September 18, 2024, this market will resolve to "No".

If McCaffrey is cut, traded, retires, placed on the injured reserve list, or is otherwise officially ruled out for the game, this market will resolve to "No". 

"Playing" is defined as Christian McCaffrey participating in at least one snap (including kickoffs) during the game. Merely being on the game-day roster will not qualify for a "Yes" resolution.

question: Will Francine hit US as a hurricane?
description:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if the storm system currently named 'Francine' makes landfall in the conterminous US for the first time as a hurricane, as reported in official National Hurricane Center advisories (https://www.nhc.noaa.gov/index.shtml). If Francine does not hit the United States by September 30, 2024, 11:59 PM ET, or otherwise dissipates before that date, this market will resolve to "No".

For the purpose of this market, a hurricane landfall is said to occur when a hurricane's surface center intersects with the coastline, as described at https://www.nhc.noaa.gov/aboutgloss.shtml#LANDFALL, and the NHC officially reports that the storm has maximum sustained winds of 74 mph or higher at the time of landfall.

This market will resolve based on an initial advisory released by the NHC that Francine has made landfall within the conterminous United States within the market timeframe regardless of any later retraction or analysis that may contradict the initial announcement.

question: Will Trump say "Haitian" at debate?
description:
Kamala Harris and Donald Trump are currently scheduled to debate on September 10 in an event hosted by ABC News. 

This market will resolve to "Yes" if Trump says "Haitian" at any point during the first presidential debate between Kamala Harris and Donald Trump in the 2024 election cycle. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

Any usage of the word regardless of context will count toward the resolution of this market.

Pluralization/possessive of the word will count toward the resolution of this market, however other forms will NOT count.

Compound words will count as long as "Haitian" is part of the compound word and references the meaning which refers to the demonym for people from Haiti.

If no such debate in the 2024 election cycle happens by November 4, 2024, 11:59 PM ET, or if either candidate drops out of the race, this market will resolve to "No".

The resolution source will be the video of the debate.

events.title: What will Trump say at the debate?

question: Kamala x Trump debate most viewed ever?
description:
The first 2016 debate between Donald Trump and Hilary Clinton is the most viewed presidential debate in history, recording 84,011,000 viewers (Persons 2+) according to Nielsen (see: https://www.nielsen.com/insights/2016/first-presidential-debate-of-2016-draws-84-million-viewers/). 

This market refers to the first presidential debate between Kamala Harris and Donald Trump scheduled for September 10, on ABC. 

This market will resolve to "Yes" if the ABC debate between Kamala Harris and Donald Trump, scheduled for September 10, 2024 has 84,011,001 or more viewers (Persons 2+) according to Nielsen. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

If no presidential debate takes place on September 10, 2024 ET,  this market will resolve to "No".

The resolution source will be information from Nielsen, specifically their Persons 2+ statistic. If Nielsen does not provide viewership information for the debate by September 17, 11:59 PM ET, another credible source may be chosen.

This market refers to the first presidential debate between Kamala Harris and Donald Trump scheduled for September 10, on ABC.

question: Eric Adams indicted in 2024?
description:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if any Federal or State jurisdiction of the United States formally charges or otherwise announces a criminal indictment of Mayor of New York City Eric Adams between September 9 and December 31, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to “No”.

For the purposes of this market the District of Columbia and any county, municipality, or other subdivision of a State shall be included within the definition of a State.

The primary resolution source for this market will be official information from US governmental sources, however a wide consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

question: Cops who arrested Tyreek Hill fired?
description:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if any of the cops involved in the September 8 detainment of Tyreek Hill get fired or resign from the Miami-Dade Police Department by September 30, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise this market will resolve "No". 

Administrative leave or suspensions will not qualify. 

The primary resolutions for this market will be official information from the Miami-Dade Police Department, however a consensus of credible reporting may also be used.

question: Will Lando Norris win the Azerbaijan Grand Prix?
description:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Lando Norris wins the 2024 Azerbaijan Grand Prix scheduled for September 15, 2024. Otherwise, this market will resolve to “No.”

If the 2024 Azerbaijan Grand Prix is canceled or rescheduled to a date after October 20, 2024, this market will resolve to “No.”

The resolution source will be the official Formula 1 website and credible sports news reporting.

question: Todd Boehly removed as Chelsea Chairman?
description:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Todd Boehly is no longer serving as chairman of Chelsea FC for any length of time between September 9 and December 31, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

An announcement of Todd Boehly's resignation/firing before this market's end date will immediately resolve this market to "Yes", regardless of when the announced resignation/firing goes into effect.

This market's primary resolution source will be official information from Chelsea and/orTodd Boehly, however a consensus of credible reporting sources will also be used.

question: Will Kamala and Trump both say "abortion" at debate?
description:
Kamala Harris and Donald Trump are currently scheduled to debate on September 10 in an event hosted by ABC News. 

This market will resolve to "Yes" if Harris and Trump each individually say "abortion" at any point during their first presidential debate in the 2024 election cycle. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

Any usage of the word regardless of context will count toward the resolution of this market.

Pluralization/possessive of the word will count toward the resolution of this market, however other forms will NOT count.

Compound words will count as long as "abortion" is part of the compound word and references the meaning which refers to the deliberate termination of a human pregnancy.

If no such debate in the 2024 election cycle happens by November 4, 2024, 11:59 PM ET, or if either candidate drops out of the race, this market will resolve to "No".

The resolution source will be the video of the debate.

events.title: What will Kamala and Trump both say at the debate?

question: Will Kamala and Trump both say "Biden" at debate?
description:
Kamala Harris and Donald Trump are currently scheduled to debate on September 10 in an event hosted by ABC News. 

This market will resolve to "Yes" if Harris and Trump each individually say "Biden" at any point during their first presidential debate in the 2024 election cycle. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

Any usage of the word regardless of context will count toward the resolution of this market.

Pluralization/possessive of the word will count toward the resolution of this market, however other forms will NOT count.

Compound words will count as long as "Biden" is part of the compound word and references the meaning which refers to the person Joe Biden.

If no such debate in the 2024 election cycle happens by November 4, 2024, 11:59 PM ET, or if either candidate drops out of the race, this market will resolve to "No".

The resolution source will be the video of the debate.

events.title: What will Kamala and Trump both say at the debate?

question: Kamala flips Trump on Silver Bulletin by Sept 30?
description:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Kamala Harris is more likely to win the 2024 U.S. Presidential Election than Donald Trump according to the Silver Bulletin for any date between September 9 and September 30, 2024 (inclusive). Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

This market will resolve as soon as a flip occurs, or otherwise once figures are available for every date within this market's range.

If there are updates to previous figures before the release of the last figure it will count for this market. However, any updates after the release of the September 30 figures will not be considered.

The resolution source will be Silver Bulletin's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model, specifically the probability of winning the Electoral College.

Note: Ties will not qualify as a flip. The model must show Kamala Harris with a greater probability of winning the electoral college than Donald Trump.

question: Will Trump lead by 0.5 or more points on September 20?
description:
This is a market on the RCP Polling Average margin between Donald Trump and Kamala Harris as of September 20, 2024, 12:00 PM ET. The spread referenced in the first table on the "2024 General Election: Trump vs. Harris" page at https://www.realclearpolling.com/polls/president/general/2024/trump-vs-harris will be used to resolve this market.

This market will resolve to 'Yes' if the RCP Polling Average margin is Trump +0.5 or more percentage points. Otherwise, this market will resolve to 'No'.

The RCP Polling Average will be checked on September 20, 12:00 PM ET.

Please note, this market refers specifically to the margin for RCP polling average as presented in the aforementioned chart in the column titled 'Spread'. This includes any adjustments or methodology changes made by RCP in their calculation of the polling average or the date range used.

If the RCP Polling Average margin data between Kamala Harris and Donald Trump is not available by September 24, 2024, 11:59 PM ET, another credible source of polling data as of September 20, 12:00 PM ET will be used for market resolution.

events.title: Trump vs. Harris polling margin Friday?
events.description: This is a market on the polling margin between Trump and Harris for the upcoming Friday.

Please note, this market refers specifically to the margin for RCP polling average as presented in the aforementioned chart in the column titled 'Spread'. This includes any adjustments or methodology changes made by RCP in their calculation of the polling average or the date range used.

question: Will Trump say "cat" at debate?
description:
Kamala Harris and Donald Trump are currently scheduled to debate on September 10 in an event hosted by ABC News. 

This market will resolve to "Yes" if Trump says "cat" at any point during the first presidential debate between Kamala Harris and Donald Trump in the 2024 election cycle. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

Any usage of the word regardless of context will count toward the resolution of this market.

Pluralization/possessive of the word will count toward the resolution of this market, however other forms will NOT count.

Compound words will count as long as "cat" is part of the compound word and references the meaning which refers to a small domesticated carnivorous mammal with soft fur, a short snout, and retractable claws.

If no such debate in the 2024 election cycle happens by November 4, 2024, 11:59 PM ET, or if either candidate drops out of the race, this market will resolve to "No".

The resolution source will be the video of the debate.
